{{Coord|32|28|44|N|35|59|6|E|type:edu|display=title}} {{advert|date=March 2016}} {{Infobox university| |name=Jordan University of Science and Technology| |native_name= جَامِعَةُ العلوم والتكنولوجيا الأردنية |image_name = JUST logo2.png |caption =Jordan University of Science and Technology Logo |image_size= 170px |type=[[Public university|Public]] |established = 1986 |president= Sa'eb A. Khresat |campus = [[urban area|Urban]]
{{convert|1.41|km2|acre}} |faculty= 962 |students = 25,354(2016/2017) |undergrad = 22,994(2016/2017) |postgrad = 2,360 (2016/2017) |endowment= $72 million;
(JOD 51 million) (2010)[http://www.alghad.com/?news=543653 Endowment for last year (2010) amounted to approximately 51 million Jordanian dinars in 2010.] | كلفة الاستثمار الكلي في الجامعة منذ التأسيس بلغت نحو 1.5 بليون دينار. |colors = Violet and Blue {{Ref_label|a|a|none}}
{{Color box|Violet}}{{Color box|Blue}} |affiliations = [[International Association of Universities|IAU]], [[Federation of the Universities of the Islamic World|FUIW]]
[[Mediterranean Universities Union|UNIMED]], [[Association of Arab Universities|AArU]]
[[International Center for Agricultural Research in the Dry Areas|ICARDA]], [[World Health Organization|WHO]]
[[Canadian International Development Agency|CIDA]], [[International Centre for Genetic Engineering and Biotechnology|ICGEB]]
[[International Centre for Theoretical Physics|ICTP]], [[German Academic Exchange Service|DAAD]] |city=[[Ar Ramtha|Al Ramtha]], [[Irbid]] |country=[[Jordan]]
{{Flagicon|Jordan}} |nickname =JUST / Techno |website = {{URL|http://www.just.edu.jo/}} |logo = [[File:JUSTWIKI.png|250px]]}} The '''Jordan University of Science and Technology''' ({{lang-ar|جامعة العلوم والتكنولوجيا الأردنية}} ''Jami'at Al-Ulum wa Al-Tiknolojia Al-Urdunia''), often abbreviated '''JUST''', is a comprehensive, [[public university|state-supported]] university located on the outskirts of [[Irbid]], at [[Ar Ramtha]] in northern [[Jordan]].{{cite web|url=http://universities.roro44.com/ar/jordan/2910/jordan_university_of_science_and_technology.html|title=جامعة أوتاوا - أوتاوا - الولايات المتحدة الأمريكية|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.university-directory.eu/Jordan/Jordan-University-of-Science-and-Technology.html|title=Jordan University of Science and Technology - TOP ranked University - University Directory|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}}http://www.libdex.com/country/jordan/irbid/library_20448.htmlhttp://www.just.edu.jo/aboutjust/Pages/Location.aspx{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo/aboutjust/Pages/default.aspx|title=About JUST|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} Since its establishment in 1986, JUST has been at the forefront of institutions of [[higher education|higher learning]] in the [[Arab world]], it also maintains a high reputation and standard amongst the universities of the [[Middle East]].http://www.just.edu.jo/aboutjust/Pages/Mission.aspx JUST and the [[University of Jordan]] in [[Amman]] are considered to be the two premier institutions of higher education for engineering and medicine in the country,{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo|title=Jordan University of Science and Technology|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} although numerous other faculties and specializations are represented as well. The university was described as the best scientific institution in the Kingdom by [[King Abdullah II]] during a visit in November '10.{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo/News/Lists/Activities/display.aspx?List=525a663d-304f-4420-a708-6adc93023c93&ID=111&RootFolder=/News/Lists/Activities|title=Prof. Omar Al-Jarrah, the vice president:"King's Vision is Our Guide Towards Globalization"|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo/News/Lists/Activities/display.aspx?List=525a663d-304f-4420-a708-6adc93023c93&ID=110&RootFolder=/News/Lists/Activities|title=His Majesty King Abdullah II: "JUST is the Best Scientific Institution in the Kingdom"|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} As of the 2006/2007 academic year, JUST had 717 faculty members, with 20,000 undergraduate and 1559 graduate students, in contrast to 2,300 students in the 1986/1987 academic year.{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo/just/Statistics.aspx|title=Statistics about Jordan University of Science and Technology|author=|date=|website=just.edu.jo|accessdate=20 March 2018}} At the present time, the university comprises 12 [[Faculty (university)|faculties]] and 55 departments providing 52 [[bachelor's degree]] and 95 [[postgraduate]] programs. JUST comprised 5,415 international students of 61 nationalities in the academic year 2009/2010, rendering it the most cultural-diverse university in Jordan.Ministry of Higher Education & Scientific Research | Statistics 2010 | http://www.mohe.gov.jo/Statistics2010/tabid/579/language/en-US/Default.aspx It was ranked as the top [[research university]] in the country, and amongst the top 3% of universities in the [[Islamic world]], according to a study carried out by the Statistical, Economic and Social Research and Training Center for Islamic Countries ([[Organisation of Islamic Cooperation#Subsidiary organs|SESRTCIC]]).Ankara-based Statistical, Economic and Social Research and Training Center for Islamic Countries (SESRTCIC). http://www.just.edu.jo/aboutjust/Pages/default.aspx {{Contains Arabic text}} ==History== [[File:Reservoir (Jordan University of Science and Technology).jpg|thumb|250px|left|The university reservoir as seen with the Engineering Buildings Complex in the background.]] A total of 2,300 students were enrolled in 1986. As of the academic year 2017/2018, about 25,000 [[undergraduate]] students and 2,500 [[graduate school|graduate]] students were enrolled at the university, representing 51 nationalities. {{cite web|url=http://www.the-businessreport.com/article/weve-obtained-20-projects-from-eu-funds-khresat/ |title=“We’ve obtained 20 projects from EU funds” |publisher=The Business Report |accessdate=14 November 2018}} Each year the university grants over 3000 Bachelor and Master [[academic degree|Degrees]]. The university started with 110 [[teacher|faculty]] members; now it hosts 750 faculty, of which 109 are full professors. The steady enrollment of the student body is grounded on the university's vision to raise and maintain the standards of higher education in Jordan, in parallel with national educational policies. Having its roots at [[Yarmouk University]] in Irbid, JUST emerged as an independent university on September 1, 1986. JUST detached five faculties from Yarmouk University to form its academic nucleus. These faculties were: Faculty of Medicine, Faculty of Dentistry, Faculty of Pharmacy, Faculty of Nursing and Faculty of Engineering. Consecutively added to these faculties are Faculty of Science and Arts, Faculty of Medical Applied Sciences, Faculty of Veterinary Medicine, Faculty of Computer and Information Technology, and Faculty of Agriculture. == University Presidents == * Prof. Kamel Ajlouni (1986-1995) * Prof. Saad Hijazi (1995-2003) * Prof. Wajih Owais (2003-2010) * Prof. Abdullah Al-Malkawi (2010-2014) * Prof. Mahmoud Alsheyab (2015-2016) * Prof. Omar Al-Jarrah (2016–2017) * Prof Saeb Khresat (2017-present) ==Campus== The [[university campus]] is located in [[Ar Ramtha]], 70 km north of [[Amman]], the capital, and 20 km east of [[Irbid]], the second largest Metropolis in Jordan. It covers an area of approximately 11 km², constructed according to modern architectural designs suitable to the nature of its faculties. The main campus is surrounded by a green cover of 135m². In addition to academic buildings and the [[Jordan University of Science and Technology#Library|JUST Library]], the campus includes the university farm, 12 auditoriums, a concert hall, fine arts galleries and museums, as well as comprising athletic facilities including a 7000-seat soccer stadium, a multipurpose indoor arena, a swimming pool, a [[squash (sport)|squash]] court, and a gym. [[File:JUSTpond.jpg|thumb|250px|right|The university reservoir at [[Jordan University of Science and Technology#Engineering Faculties Complex|The Engineering Faculties Complex]].]] [[File:Medical Halls (Jordan University of Science and Technology).jpg|thumb|right|250px|Medical halls of JUST as seen with [[King Abdullah University Hospital|KAUH]].]]The university campus is divided into two sections, known as the '''[[Jordan University of Science and Technology#Medical Faculties Complex|Medical Faculties Complex]]''', a group of buildings in the northern part of the university, comprising the faculties of Dentistry, Medicine, Nursing, Applied Medical Sciences, Pharmacy and Science and Arts, and the '''[[Jordan University of Science and Technology#Engineering Faculties Complex|Engineering Faculties Complex]]''', a group of buildings in the southern part of the university, compromising the faculties of Agriculture, Computer and Information Technology, Engineering, Architecture and Design and Veterinary Medicine. Students can use available buses to move from one complex to the other. Although there is a mini train on campus, it is not often used, and due to the relatively short distance between the two complexes many students prefer walking. There are two libraries in JUST, one in the Engineering Faculties Complex and the other is in the Medical Faculties Complex. While both libraries give the students an appropriate and suitable place for reading and studying, the two-floor library at the Medical Faculties Complex is relatively larger, also contains 115,000 books, and 45,000 volumes of back issues of [[periodicals]], which makes it the main library at the university.{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo/library/default.aspx|title=The Library at Jordan University of Science and Technology|author=|date=|website=just.edu.jo|accessdate=20 March 2018}} At the present time, a third library is being constructed in the area between the Engineering Faculties Complex and the Medical Faculties Complex which is larger in size than both existing libraries and is set to become the largest library in the Middle East.http://oldwww.just.edu.jo/library/|JUST Library Aside from the employees and guests restaurants, there are also three restaurants for students; one in each main campus, and one located near the soccer stadium. Every department has a [[computer laboratory]] for the students to use. There are also two open labs one in each campus. Moreover, six additional labs are available for the [[graduate school|graduate]] and [[undergraduate]] computer science students and students who are taking related courses at the PH building located at the Medicine Faculties Building. The campus is covered by a secure [[wireless internet]] connection ([[WLAN]]).{{cite web|url=http://www.microsoft.com/casestudies/casestudy.aspx?casestudyid=4000001061|title=Microsoft Customers|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} ===King Abdullah University Hospital=== {{Main article|King Abdullah University Hospital}} Named after the first king of modern [[Jordan]], [[King Abdullah I|Abdullah I bin al-Hussein]], the King Abdullah University Hospital ([[KAUH]]) is the largest hospital in northern Jordan, serving approximately one million inhabitants of the [[Irbid Governorate|Irbid]], [[Ajloun Governorate|Ajloun]], [[Jerash Governorate|Jerash]], and [[Mafraq Governorate|Mafraq]] governorates. It is also the [[teaching hospital]] affiliated with Jordan University of Science and Technology, located within the campus adjacent to the university's [[Jordan University of Science and Technology#Medical Faculties Complex|Medical Faculties Complex]].http://www.kauh.jo/kauh/english/index.aspx The hospital is staffed with full-time physicians and surgeons who are faculty members of the JUST Faculty of Medicine, in addition to many others from the Ministry of Health, and the Royal Medical Services (RMS). The overall area of various hospital buildings is 95583m², in addition to a [[Multi-story car park|double story car park]] of 9000m² area. The hospital has a bed capacity of 683 which can be increased to 800 beds in an [[emergency|emergency situation]]. Structurally, the hospital is composed of a 15-story [[high-rise|high-rise building]], in which all hospital beds are located, and a 3-story [[low-rise|low-rise buildings]] in which [[clinic|patient clinics]], [[diagnostic]] and other services are located. The hospital is connected to various [[health science]] [[Faculty (university)|faculties]] via the ground floor of the low-rise building. The hospital includes the departments of [[General Surgery]], [[Surgery|Special Surgery]], [[Emergency Medicine|Emergency Department]], [[Pediatrics]], [[Obstetrics]] and [[Gynecology]], [[Internal Medicine]] and [[Dermatology]], [[Cardiology|Cardiac Center]], [[X-ray|Diagnostic X-Ray]], [[Pathology|Pathology and Laboratory]], [[Endoscopy|Endoscopy Unit]], [[Physical Therapy]] and [[Psychiatric rehabilitation|Rehabilitation]], [[Physiology|Physiology Function Test]], [[Neuroscience]], Nursing and Information System Department. {{wide image|Red Hall in King Abdullah University Hospital (panorama).jpg|1200px| The Red Hall in [[King Abdullah University Hospital]], the [[teaching hospital]] of JUST. - Photo by Aymx}} ==Academics== ''Jordan University of Science and Technology'' is home to twelve faculties.{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo/faculty/index.aspx|title=Faculties at Jordan University of Science and Technology|author=|date=|website=just.edu.jo|accessdate=20 March 2018}} The medium of teaching at the university; lectures, exams, and tuition, are primarily in [[English language]], with [[Arabic]] being used mainly to facilitate student understanding as the greater majority of students are of [[Arab]] background.{{cite web|url=http://qahwasaada.blogspot.com/2010/08/its-my-life.html|title=Qahwa Saada: It's My Life|first=Yazan|last=Mousa|date=30 August 2010|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} ===Medical Faculties Complex=== {{Coord|32|29|57|N|35|59|34|E|type:edu}} [[File:Main Gate, Jordan University of Science and Technology (2009).jpg|thumb|265px|right|The main entrance to the JUST campus.]] A group of building in the northern part of the university comprising the faculties of Medicine, Dentistry, Pharmacy, Nursing, Applied Medical Sciences, and Science and Arts. ====Medicine==== The JUST Faculty of Medicine, the second [[medical school]] in Jordan, was established in [[Yarmouk University]] at the northern city of Irbid in 1984; the faculty then branched out into Jordan University of Science and Technology in 1986."Medical education in Jordan." AHMAD FALEH TAMIMI(1) & FALEH TAMIMI(2); (1)Jordan University, Jordan, (2)McGill University, Canada. The faculty is closely associated with [[King Abdullah University Hospital]], the [[teaching hospital]] where [[postgraduate]] students undergo their residencies.{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo/facultiesanddepartments/facultyofmedicine/Pages/default.aspx|title=Faculty of Medicine|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} As the faculty’s main teaching hospital, KAUH provide students with the opportunity to attend lectures, tutorials, clinics, ward rounds, and surgeries. Medical students graduating from JUST are widely renowned for their achievements in the United States Medical Licensing Examination ([[USMLE]]), gaining postgraduate positions in well-known global institutions.Dr. Faisal Bakaeen MD on Jordan's Medical Field | Jordan Business | Issue 54 | June 2009 Furthermore, the Faculty of Medicine has been an active participant in medical research and has hosted numerous international events and conferences, with focus on subjects in relation to [[myocardial]] protection and research, [[pediatrics]], [[anesthesia]], and [[internal medicine]]. As of September 2011, the faculty will be hosting the [[Fellow of the Royal College of Pathologists]] (FRC Path) Part 1 written exams in all Pathology specialties, which will enable Jordanian and Arab Pathologists to sit the exam outside the [[UK]].{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo/News/Lists/Activities/display.aspx?List=525a663d-304f-4420-a708-6adc93023c93&ID=175&RootFolder=/News/Lists/Activities&Web=79c410a4-cba9-460c-a9bb-dbc13ce3ee34|title=The Royal College of Pathologists in the United Kingdom has approved JUST as a host centre for the FRCPath Part 1 written exams in all Pathology specialties|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} =====Nature of the Medical Program===== The Faculty of Medicine awards the [[Bachelor of Medicine and Surgery]] (MBBS) after completion of six years comprising three years of [[medical sciences]] and three clinical years. Students are admitted to medicine based solely on their grade point average in their high school national general exam ([[Tawjihi]]); there are neither entrance interviews nor psychometric exams. The cutoff average used for admissions into medicine is the highest among all the other disciplines offered by universities. For example, the cutoff average used over the past five years has been: 94.9 (2005), 96.3 (2006), 97 (2007), 96.8 (2008), and 97.7 (2009). Although in the minority, the faculty of medicine accepts students from [[Israel]], [[State of Palestine|Palestine]], [[Syria]], Arab states of the [[Persian Gulf]], [[Malaysia]], and other countries. Tuition is significantly higher for the foreign students. Initially, the faculty at JUST accepted 50 students into the program, but that number has grown to more than 200 in recent years.Medicine in Jordan: A Cross-Cultural Elective Experience | Samer Dabbo (1T1), Faculty of Medicine, University of Toronto, Jordan University of Science and Technology. During the first year and a half of their program, students are taught basic science in a traditional format. In an integrated module fashion, the next year and half is devoted to studying nine [[body systems]]: [[cardiovascular]], [[respiratory]], [[hematopoietic]], [[digestion|digestive]], [[endocrine]], [[musculoskeletal]], [[neuroscience]] 1 and 2, and [[reproductive]] and [[urinary]]. Towards the end of the third year students begin direct contact with patients in hospital settings. The last three years are spent in supervised inpatient and outpatient settings to develop their diagnostic and treatment competencies; the clinical years begin fully at the beginning of year 4 where students rotate through various areas of general clinical medicine. Year 5 continues this pattern focusing more on specialized areas of medicine and surgery. In total, students are required to complete 257 hours of classes divided among compulsory and elective courses. After completion of their 6th year, students are required to complete internship (imtiaz), which is a one-year term in general practice for which they are not compensated for. Evaluations are based primarily on written exams (marks are based on two midterms and one end of term exam) and percentage grades appear on transcripts. Practical exams are solely based on an [[objective structured clinical examination]] (OSCE) type of standardized exams. In the final year, the school of medicine invites external examiners (from the [[United States]], [[United Kingdom|Britain]], among others) to participate in student evaluations and to benefit from the experience of others. =====Residency===== Students looking to specialize can apply for residency programs after completion of imtiaz (internship). Most residency programs are four years in length, but notable exceptions include [[neurosurgery]] (6 years), [[general surgery]] (5 years), [[orthopedic surgery]] (5 years), and [[urology]] (5 years). Residency programs are divided into two broad groups: major and minor specialties. Major programs include internal medicine, pediatrics, obstetrics and gynecology, while the rest are considered minor. This division reflects the number of available seats and thus the competitiveness of each specialty. [http://www.just.edu.jo/faculty/welcome.aspx?fac_id=3 Faculty of Medicine] {{main article|Medical education in Jordan}} ====Dentistry==== The Faculty of Dentistry at Jordan University of Science and Technology was founded by a [[royal decree]] on 16 September 1983 and the first group of students was admitted in the academic year 1984/1985. The faculty offers facilities for undergraduate and postgraduate training and is developing programs for all professionals in dentistry who wish to continue their education and obtain further qualifications.{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo/facultiesanddepartments/facultyofdentistry/Pages/default.aspx|title=Faculty of Dentistry|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} [http://www.just.edu.jo/FacultiesandDepartments/FacultyofDentistry/Pages/Highlights.aspx Faculty of Dentistry] ====Pharmacy==== The Faculty of [[Pharmacy]], the first in Jordan,{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo/facultiesanddepartments/facultyofpharmacy/Pages/default.aspx|title=Faculty of Pharmacy|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} was established as a department of the Faculty of Medical Sciences at [[Yarmouk University]] by a royal decree in 1979. The rapid growth and development of the department led to the transformation of the department into an independent faculty on September 19, 1983. Three years later -in September 1986- the Faculty of Pharmacy became affiliated with JUST. [http://www.just.edu.jo/facultiesanddepartments/facultyofpharmacy/Pages/Highlights.aspx Faculty of Pharmacy] ====Nursing==== The Faculty of Nursing was established in 1983 with only 2 faculty members and 23 students. It currently consists of 23 [[PhD]], and 22 [[Master's degree|Masters]] prepared faculty members (Adult, Maternal Child, Community & Midwifery) placed in the four departments of the faculty; this body is supported by 27 [[Master of Science in Nursing|MSN]] or [[Bachelor of Science in Nursing|BSN]] qualified clinical trainers.{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo/facultiesanddepartments/facultyofnursing/Pages/default.aspx|title=Faculty of Nursing|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} [http://www.just.edu.jo/facultiesanddepartments/facultyofnursing/Pages/Highlights.aspx Faculty of Nursing] ====Applied Medical Sciences==== The Faculty of Applied Medical Sciences was established in 2000, and was housed in several makeshift facilities. It was created to educate allied health professionals to fill crucial shortages in the [[health care]] needs of the people in Jordan. The faculty has since become a dynamic and vital member of the university health team.{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo/FacultiesandDepartments/FacultyofAppliedMedicalSciences/Pages/Welcome.aspx|title=Error|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} The faculty also has a number of sponsored students who are pursuing [[graduate studies]] leading to M.Sc. and Ph.D. degrees in various majors at well-known universities in the USA, UK, and Australia. Upon graduation, they will join the faculty.{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo/facultiesanddepartments/facultyofappliedmedicalSciences/Pages/default.aspx|title=Faculty of Applied Medical Sciences|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} [http://www.just.edu.jo/facultiesanddepartments/facultyofappliedmedicalSciences/Pages/Highlights.aspx Faculty of Applied Medical Sciences] ====Science and Arts==== The Faculty of Science and Arts was established by a decree from the [[Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research (Jordan)|Council of Higher Education]] on January 26, 1987. It commenced its duties as of September 1, 1987. The faculty, one of the oldest and largest at the university, holds seven departments and a program of [[forensic science]], offers both bachelor's and master's degrees and gives students the chance to choose from a plethora of disciplines that employ several pedagogical approaches involving classroom instruction, independent research, student-as-teacher approach, and internships or practical experience.{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo/FacultiesandDepartments/FacultyofScienceandArts/Pages/default.aspx|title=Faculty of Science and Arts|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} [http://www.just.edu.jo/FacultiesandDepartments/FacultyofScienceandArts/Pages/Highlights.aspx Faculty of Science and Arts] ===Engineering Faculties Complex=== {{Coord|32|29|33|N|35|59|14|E|type:edu}} [[File:JUSTuni2.jpeg|thumb|200px|right|The [[Jordan University of Science and Technology#Medical Faculties Complex|Medical Faculties Complex]].]] A group of buildings in the southern part of the university comprising the faculties of Engineering, Agriculture, Information Technology, Architecture and Design, Veterinary Medicine, and [[Graduate Studies]]. ====Engineering==== The Faculty of Engineering is the largest faculty in the university, with its 61 research and teaching labs. It comprises the departments of [[Biomedical Engineering]], [[Aeronautical Engineering]], [[Chemical Engineering]], [[Civil Engineering]], [[Electrical Engineering]], [[Industrial Engineering]], [[Mechanical Engineering]] power and mechatronics, and [[Nuclear Engineering]]. The Faculty takes part and is accredited by the United States Engineering Accreditation Commission (EAC) of ([[ABET]]).{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo/facultiesanddepartments/facultyofengineering/Pages/Highlights.aspx|title=Highlights|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} ====Agriculture==== The Faculty of Agriculture was established by a [[royal decree]] on October 2, 1985. Study began at the faculty in 1989/1990 with 71 students, to grow into over 1100 students in the academic year 2006/2007, including 100 graduate students. The faculty began with only nine faculty members upon its establishment. Currently, the number has increased into 48 faculty members in four academic departments.{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo/facultiesanddepartments/facultyofagriculture/Pages/default.aspx|title=Faculty of Agriculture|publisher=|accessdate=}} ====Information Technology==== The Faculty of Information Technology was established in 2000 and has built an international reputation for excellence in teaching, research, and services since then.{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo/FacultiesandDepartments/it/Pages/Welcome.aspx|title=Welcome|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} The Faculty consists of five departments: [[Computer Engineering]], [[Computer Science]], [[Computer Information System]], [[Software Engineering]], and [[Computer network|Network Engineering]]. As one of the largest faculties with 42 faculty members and 1972 students, it is consistently ranked as one of the Middle East's top and essential learning bodies of information and technology as attested by many institutions and specialists.{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo/FacultiesandDepartments/IT/Pages/default.aspx|title=Faculty Of Computer & Information Technology|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} ====Architecture and Design==== The Faculty of Architecture and Design awards both [[bachelor's degrees]] and [[master's degrees]] and comprises the departments of [[architecture]] and [[urban planning]]. It participates yearly in the Arab Architectural Graduation Project Exhibition, which started as Bilad Al Sham Graduation Project Exhibition.{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo/FacultiesandDepartments/FacultyofArchitectureandDesign/Pages/default.aspx|title=College of Architecture and Design|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} ====Veterinary Medicine==== The Faculty of [[Veterinary Medicine]] was established at JUST in 1990 as a response to the national objective of improving [[animal health]] and productivity by increasing their efficiency and thereby reducing the cost of animal production. It is the only Faculty of Veterinary Medicine in Jordan.{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo/FacultiesandDepartments/FacultyOfVeterinaryMedicine/Pages/Welcome.aspx|title=Welcome|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} It also houses a Veterinary Health Center (VHC), which serves the purpose of clinical training for students and provides veterinary services to the public. The faculty is a research and a consultative center, in addition to its basic function in promoting and sustaining high standards of undergraduate and postgraduate programs. The faculty is an active member of the Arab Association of Veterinary Medical Faculties and it houses its office.{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo/FacultiesandDepartments/FacultyOfVeterinaryMedicine/Pages/default.aspx|title=Faculty of Veterinary Medicine|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} ====Graduate Studies==== The Faculty of [[Graduate Studies]] provides advanced studies in different fields including Medicine, Applied Medical Sciences, Science, Nursing, Dentistry, Pharmacy, Veterinary Medicine, Agriculture, Engineering and Computer Technology. The faculty is entrusted with setting the rules and regulations pertinent to graduate programs and degrees and pursuing the implementation of these regulations.{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo/FacultiesandDepartments/FacultyofGraduateStudies/Pages/default.aspx|title=Welcome|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} Each faculty is best known with a color: {| class="wikitable" |- ! Faculty of Agriculture !! Faculty of Applied Medical Sciences !! Faculty of Computer and Information Technology !! Faculty of Dentistry !! Faculty of Engineering !! Faculty of Medicine !! Faculty of Nursing|| Faculty of Pharmacy !! Faculty of Science and Arts !! Faculty of Veterinary Medicine |- | {{color box|#4eb84c}}  || {{color box|#fe9494}}  || {{color box|#dbdb91}}  || {{color box|#b793db}}  || {{color box|#ffdb4e}}  || {{color box|#fe4a4b}}  || {{color box|#dbdbdb}}  || {{color box|#99dd54}}  || {{color box|#3b64b6}}  || {{color box|#ffbc78}}  |} ===Research=== Since its establishment, JUST has given its utmost priority to academic research. In this vein, the '''Deanship of Research''' commenced its activities at the early stages of the university establishment during the academic year 1986/1987. Research, basic and applied, is amongst the principal priorities of the university. Training and supervision in research methodology, especially for postgraduate students, is reinforced by several research centers, such as the [[Queen Rania]] Center for Environmental Science and Technology, Consultative Center for Science and Technology, Energy Center, Pharmaceutical Research Center, [[Princess Haya Biotechnology Center]], and the Agricultural Center for Research & Production.{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo/Deanships/DeanshipofResearch/Pages/Highlights.aspx|title=Highlights|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} Research funding has steadily grown since the establishment of JUST in 1986, and an average of 200 research projects are sponsored and funded each year. As testimony to this development, JUST was ranked as the top [[research university]] in Jordan, and amongst the top 3% universities in the [[Islamic world]], according to a study carried out by the Ankara-based Statistical, Economic and Social Research and Training Center for Islamic Countries (SESRTCIC). [[Nature (journal)|Nature Journal]] has reported Jordan as having the highest number of researchers in [[research and development]] per million people among all the 57 countries members of the [[Organisation of Islamic Cooperation]] (OIC). In Jordan there are 2,000 researchers per million people, while the average among the members of OIC is 500 researchers per million people.{{cite journal|url=http://www.nature.com/nature/journal/v444/n7115/full/444026a.html|title=Islam and Science: The data gap|first=Declan|last=Butler|date=2 November 2006|publisher=|journal=Nature|volume=444|issue=7115|pages=26–27|accessdate=24 November 2016|via=www.nature.com|doi=10.1038/444026a}} This means that the number of researchers per population in Jordan, is higher than Italy, [[Israel]] and Greece and just close to the number in [[United Kingdom]] and Ireland.http://www.nationmaster.com/graph/eco_res_in_ram_per_mil_peo-amp-d-per-million-people{{cite web|url=http://www.jordaninvestment.com/BusinessandInvestment/PeopleDemographicsLabor/ResearchDevelopment/tabid/171/language/en-US/Default.aspx |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2010-07-25 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110126074649/http://www.jordaninvestment.com/BusinessandInvestment/PeopleDemographicsLabor/ResearchDevelopment/tabid/171/language/en-US/Default.aspx |archivedate=2011-01-26 |df= }} The Deanship of Research at JUST is the administrative and technical body that facilitates, regulates and observes the processes concerning research. It works in a collaborative and complementary manner with other faculties and administrative bodies of the university. Any research on humans should be approved by the Institutional Research Board (IRB) and any research on animals should be approved by the university Animal Care and Use Committee (ACUC) before being funded. [http://www.just.edu.jo/Deanships/DeanshipofResearch/Pages/welcome.aspx Deanship of Research] ===Nuclear Science and Technology Center=== {{see also|Jordan Research and Training Reactor}} In consistence with Jordan's efforts to develop and use [[nuclear power|nuclear energy]] for peaceful purposes{{cite web|url=http://www.indepthnews.net/news/news.php?key1=2010-02-02%2000:00:34&key2=1|title=Home - IDN-InDepthNews - Analysis That Matters|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.jordantimes.com/?news=25329|title=Jordan Times|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} and lessen its dependence on fossil fuel, and in co-ordinance with the Department of Nuclear Engineering of JUST, a [[nuclear research reactor]], the first in the country,{{cite web|url=http://www.jordantimes.com/?news=22076|title=Jordan Times|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} has been set to be built in the [[university campus]] which will serve as an integral part of the [[nuclear technology]] infrastructure of Jordan.http://www.zawya.com/Story.cfm/sidZAWYA20100331044301/Jordan,%20S.%20Korea%20sign%20deal%20on%20nuclear%20research%20reactor/ The five-megawatt (MW) nuclear research reactor, which was inaugurated in December 2016,http://www.tradingmarkets.com/news/press-release/erc_s-korea-consortium-wins-deal-to-build-research-reactor-for-jordan-879751.html will become the focal point for a '''Nuclear Science and Technology Center (NSTC)''' in JUST,{{cite web|url=http://www.world-nuclear-news.org/NN-Korean_consortium_for_Jordans_first_reactor-0712097.html|title=Korean consortium for Jordan's first reactor|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2010/05/120_56698.html|title=Korea to Build Nuclear Research Reactor in Jordan|date=4 December 2009|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} playing the primary role in educating and training the upcoming generations of [[nuclear engineering|nuclear engineers]] and scientists, and providing [[irradiation]] services in support of the Jordanian industrial, agricultural and health/medical infrastructures.{{cite web|url=http://www.scidev.net/en/news/jordan-unveils-nuclear-energy-strategy.html|title=Jordan unveils nuclear energy strategy|first=|last=SciDev.Net|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} The [[nuclear research]] reactor center will include [[radioisotope production]] and training facilities, future expansion of the center will include a fuel fabrication plant, as well as radioactive waste and cold neutron facilities. The reactor, which will be upgradeable to 10MW, will facilitate the training of nuclear operators and technicians as well as advanced nuclear research in neutron sciences and the commercial production of [[radioisotopes]], it will also allow for practical experience for Jordanians in [[nuclear power|nuclear energy]], reactor physics, [[radiochemistry]] and [[radiation protection]].{{cite web|url=http://www.jordantimes.com/?news=28679|title=Jordan Times|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} The [[research reactor]] is considered by [[Jordan Atomic Energy Commission|Jordan Atomic Energy Commission (JAEC)]] officials to be an important precursor to Jordan's first [[nuclear power plant]], a 750-1,000MW Generation III reactor to be built in an area in [[Mafraq Governorate|Mafraq]] 40 kilometers northeast of [[Amman]] and 15 kilometers away from the [[Hashemite University]].http://www.jordantimes.com/?news=32645 JAEC changes nuclear reactor sitehttp://www.greenenergy-jo.com/keynote%20speakers/Dr.Khaled.pdf On 1 November 2010, the university inaugurated the first Internet Reactor Laboratory in the country. The reactor laboratory links the university's nuclear engineering department with the [[U.S]] [[Pulstar (nuclear reactor)|PULSTAR]] research reactor at [[North Carolina State University]], making it the first U.S research nuclear reactor to be used for educational purposes outside the United States. The new laboratory will enable JUST nuclear engineering students to use the PULSTAR reactor and observe the reactor's behavior under certain conditions via a virtual control panel. The project was set up in cooperation with the Jordan Atomic Energy Commission, [[U.S Department of State]], and the [[International Atomic Energy Agency]].{{cite web|url=http://en.ammonnews.net/article.aspx?articleNO=10448|title=Jordan inaugurates Internet Reactor Laboratory - Culture & Society - Ammon News|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}}http://www.almadenahnews.com/newss/news.php?c=127&id=60561{{cite web|url=http://www.alrai.com/pages.php?news_id=366567|title=صحيفة الرأي :: الرئيسية|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} During a visit to the university in November 2010, [[King Abdullah II|King Abdullah]] unveiled a model for the 5-megawatt Jordanian research and training facility, calling for creating institutional frameworks to increase investments in research, encourage and support innovative individuals, and lauding the university for the advanced level it has achieved in various sciences.{{cite web|url=http://en.ammonnews.net/article.aspx?articleNO=10933|title=King opens Jordan Nuclear Research Center - Business - Ammon News|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} ===Center of Excellence for Service Science Innovation=== International Business Machines Corp. ([[IBM]]) and the Jordan University of Science and Technology (JUST) are set to create a '''Center of Excellence for Service Science Innovation''' at the university's campus in Irbid. The new centre will deliver teaching resources and technology expertise to students over a [[cloud computing]] infrastructure - the first system of its kind in the [[Middle East]]. IBM consultants will also support JUST with curriculum development and provide expertise in the area of [[service science, management and engineering]] (SSME).{{cite web|url=http://www-03.ibm.com/press/us/en/pressrelease/32738.wss|title=Jordan University of Science and Technology Partners with IBM to Build New Cloud Computing Centre|date=13 October 2010|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}}http://www.tradingmarkets.com/news/stock-alert/ibm_jordan-university-of-science-and-technology-partners-with-ibm-to-build-new-cloud-computing-centre-1235199.html The solution will be based on IBM's CloudBurst, which is an integrated service delivery platform that includes [[BladeCenter]] technology, storage, networking, virtualization and service management software. The workload-optimized system will provide JUST with a private cloud environment as a platform for innovation. IBM will also help to coordinate the centre and assist JUST in developing new curricula on key technology areas such as Service Oriented Architecture ([[Service-oriented architecture|SOA]]), Business Processes Management ([[Business process management|BPM]]), [[Business Analytics]], Business Processes Optimization (BPO), Service Science and Cloud Computing. IBM will use its expertise in these areas and draw on skills from its research and development laboratories to help develop educational resources and run workshops, courses, internships and certification programs. The initiative will support the university in driving skills and expertise in services science to the benefit of national schools, higher education and research establishments in Jordan and beyond.{{cite web|url=http://www.itp.net/582101-ibm-and-just-to-create-service-science-centre|title=IBM and JUST to create Service Science Centre - - ITP.net|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.globalprintmonitor.com/en/gpm-technology/cloud/35067-jordan-university-of-science-and-technology-partners-with-ibm-to-build-new-cloud-computing-centre-|title=globalprintmonitor.com|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} ==Library== The library collection comprises 115,000 books, and 45,000 volumes of periodicals back issues. In organizing its collection, the Library adopts the [[Library of Congress Classification|Library of Congress Classification Scheme]], and uses the [[Anglo-American Cataloging Rules]] ([[AACR2]]) and the International Standard of Bibliographic Description ([[International Standard Bibliographic Description|ISBD]]). To cope with the new technologies in the field of library and [[information science]], the library started in 1993 to offer retrieved information services through a good number of necessary databases, which are published on [[CD-ROM]] or online ([[Wide area network|WAN]]) subscriptions.[http://www.just.edu.jo/library/default.aspx] [[File:JUST newlibrary.jpg|right|thumb|300px|The new library, which is set to become the largest library in the Middle East, under construction at JUST.]] There are two libraries in JUST, one in the [[Jordan University of Science and Technology#Engineering Faculties Complex|Engineering Faculties Complex]] and the other is in the [[Jordan University of Science and Technology#Medical Faculties Complex|Medical Faculties Complex]]. While both libraries give the students an appropriate and suitable place for reading and studying, the two-floor library at the Medical Faculties Complex is relatively larger, also contains 115,000 books, and 45,000 volumes of back issues of periodicals, which makes it the main library at the university.At the present time, a third library is being built in the area between the two complexes and is larger in size than both existing libraries and is set to become the largest library in the Middle East. [[File:Jordan University of Science and Technology's Library.jpg|thumb|Largest library in the Middle East.]] ==Publications== {{Expand section|date=May 2010}} The university issues a quarterly journal called the ''[[Jordan Journal of Civil Engineering]]'' (JJCE). The journal is internationally peer-reviewed. Subjects covered include applications of civil rehabilatations, structural control, [[smart materials]], [[earthquake engineering]], [[geotechnical engineering]] and soil/[[rock mechanics]], dam engineering, traffic and [[transportation engineering]], water and [[environmental engineering]], [[construction management]] and [[project planning]], surveying and mapping, and infrastructures engineering, as well as numerical and [[analysis|analytical methods]].{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo/jjce/aims_scope.htm|title=Jordan Journal of Civil Engineering Scope|author=|date=|website=just.edu.jo|accessdate=20 March 2018}} The Deanship of Research is responsible for the funding of research publications by staff members and students, as well as managing the Jordan Journal of Civil Engineering. :''Further information: [[Jordan University of Science and Technology#Research|Research at Jordan University of Science and Technology]]'' ==Student Newspaper== [[Just for Just]], is an electronic newspaper initiated by the students of the university.{{Cite web|url=http://www.justforjust.com|title=just for JUST|website=www.justforjust.com|language=de|access-date=2017-09-30}} ==Students== A [[students' union]] is elected annually to represent the students. Student clubs that are responsible for organizing various events throughout the academic year. Of the most prominent of these clubs are the Medical Club, [[Arab revolt|Great Arab Revolt]] Club, Media Club, Science Club, International student Club, Chess Club, and Culture Club.{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo/Deanships/DeanshipofStudentsAffairs/StudentClubs/Pages/default.aspx|title=Home|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} ===International community=== The number of international students at JUST continues to rise; in the academic year 2005/2006, more than 3,500 students of 48 nationalities came from outside Jordan. As of the academic year 2009/2010, the university comprised 5,415 international students from 61 different nationalities, rendering it the most cultural-diverse university in Jordan.AlGhad News | Issue 2/7/10 | President of JUST Patronizes the 22nd commencement of JUST's Graduate and Undergraduate Students | http://alghad.com/?news=516190JUST Graduates 22nd Class | http://www.just.edu.jo/News/Lists/Activities/display.aspx?List=525a663d-304f-4420-a708-6adc93023c93&ID=71&RootFolder=%2FNews%2FLists%2FActivities The International Student Office (ISO) was established in 2005 and is supervised directly by the president. Highly qualified coordinators and staff provide cultural, social and legal consultation, field trips, social events, and meetings with the president. An International Community Fair takes place annually at the university with the aim of encouraging and promoting [[cross-cultural communication]] and diversity in the workplace. {{wide image|JUSTcommunityfair.jpg|1120px| [[Panoramic photography|Panoramic photo]] of students in the [[Jordan University of Science and Technology#Engineering Faculties Complex|Engineering Faculties Complex]] during the [[International Community]] Fair at Jordan University of Science and Technology. - Photo by Hassan Ali}} ===Housing=== ====On-campus housing==== The first building was established in 1993. Due to increasing demand, the number of buildings was gradually raised to eight fully occupied buildings. Each building consists of four floors, the ground floor included. Each floor consists of two major wards, each of which contains eleven rooms, in addition to an adequate number of [[bathrooms]] and [[showers]] associated with each ward. Each building offers three types of rooms, as follows:{{cite web|url=http://www.just.edu.jo/Deanships/DeanshipofStudentsAffairs/StudentServices/housingservices/Pages/Services.aspx|title=Error|publisher=|accessdate=24 November 2016}} ===Health care and insurance=== Health care is available to all students, the cost of which is included in the semester fees. It covers 100% of most services offered by the University Health Centers, including [[King Abdullah University Hospital]] (KAUH) and the JUST Health Center (HC). The university provides free life insurance coverage to all students. JUST Health Center (HC) in Irbid was established in 1983 to provide medical care to students, faculty and staff. It is also a [[teaching hospital|teaching center]] for the residency program of [[family medicine]]. ==Faculty== * [[Kamel Ajlouni]], endocrinologist and university president from 1986 to 1995. ==International affiliations== * [[Association of Arab Universities|Association of Arab Universities (AArU)]]http://www.just.edu.jo/aboutjust/Pages/International%20Relations.aspx * [[International Association of Universities|International Association of Universities (IAU)]] * [[Federation of the Universities of the Islamic World|Federation of the Universities of the Islamic World (FUIW)]] * [[Mediterranean Universities Union|Mediterranean Universities Union (UNIMED)]] * Royal Norwegian Commission * IKIP/Malaysia * [[International Center for Agricultural Research in the Dry Areas]] (ICARDA) * [[World Health Organization]] (WHO) * [[Canadian International Development Agency]] (CIDA) * [[European Union|EU]] * [[International Centre for Genetic Engineering and Biotechnology]] (ICGEB) * [[UNESCO]] * [[Alexander von Humboldt Foundation]]/Germany * [[International Centre for Theoretical Physics]]/Italy * [[German Academic Exchange Service]] (DAAD) * [[The British Council]]/ODA * The French Mission for Agriculture and Water ([[Fulbright Program|Fulbright]]) * [[Cisco]] Systems * Boscan International * [[Microsoft]] * [[IBM]]{{cite web |url=http://www-03.ibm.com/press/us/en/pressrelease/32738.wss |title=Jordan University of Science and Technology Partners with IBM to Build New Cloud Computing Centre |date=13 October 2010 |location=Amman, Jordan}} ==Photo gallery== File:AymxJUST1.jpg|The main gate of JUST at night. File:KAUHaymx2.jpg|''[[King Abdullah University Hospital]]'' and the mosque of JUST at night. File:JUSTuni3.jpeg|''Science Hall 2'' at the Medical Faculties Complex. File:Main entranceJUST.jpg|Entrance to JUST. File:JUSTuni13.jpeg|Stadium at the Engineering Faculties Complex. File:JUST-fac-eng.jpeg|''Faculty of Information Technology'' at the Engineering Faculties Complex. File:JUSTuni7.jpeg|Main gate. File:JUSTuni6.jpeg|Clipped hedge at the Faculty of Architecture. File:JUSTuni8.jpeg|Night view of campus. File:JUSTuni10.jpeg|JUST mosque. File:JUSTuni12.jpeg|Main gate at night. File:JUSTlogo.jpg|JUST 1986 logo. File:JUSTuni9.jpeg|[[Bus|Transportation buses]] are used in the 11 km2 university campus. ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} {{Portal|University|Jordan}} ==External links== {{Commons|Jordan University of Science and Technology}} *[http://www.just.edu.jo/ Jordan University of Science and Technology] {{Universities in Jordan}} {{UNIMED}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Jordan University Of Science And Technology}} [[Category:Universities in Jordan]] [[Category:Science and technology in Jordan]] [[Category:Education in Jordan]] [[Category:Educational institutions established in 1986]] [[Category:Research institutes in Jordan]] [[Category:Irbid Governorate]] [[Category:Jordan University of Science and Technology| ]] [[Category:1986 establishments in Jordan]]

'''Judith Hanson Lasater''' is an American yoga teacher and writer in the San Francisco Bay Area.
She was an early disciple of [[B.K.S. Iyengar]] and helped to popularize both [[Iyengar Yoga|Iyengar]] and [[Restorative Yoga]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Isaacs |first=Nora |title=Exercisers Slow It Down With Qigong |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2007/04/05/fashion/05Fitness.html |publisher=The New York Times |date=2007-04-05 |accessdate=2007-10-03}}</ref>
Lasater holds a doctorate in East-West psychology and is a physical therapist, and has taught yoga since 1971. <ref name="JHL">{{cite web|url=http://www.judithlasater.com/about/ |title=About Judith |accessdate=2006-12-04 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20061101140531/http://www.judithlasater.com/about/ |archivedate=2006-11-01 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
Lasater is President of The California Yoga Teachers Association (CYTA), which she cofounded in 1974.<ref>{{cite book |last=Schneider |first=Carrie |title= American Yoga: The Paths and Practices of America's Greatest Yoga Masters |year= 2003|publisher=Barnes & Noble|location= New York|isbn= 0-7607-4558-7|pages=87}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Hann |first=Joelle |title=Between Poses, a Barrage of Pickup Lines |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2007/08/23/fashion/23Fitness.html |publisher=The New York Times |date=2007-08-23 |accessdate=2007-10-03}}</ref>
In addition, Lasater is a founder of the Iyengar Yoga Institute in San Francisco as well as a founder of [[Yoga Journal]] magazine, where she continues to serve on the advisory boards.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.yogateachersassoc.org/board/ |title=California Yoga Teachers Association Board of Directors |accessdate=2006-12-04 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060823210635/http://www.yogateachersassoc.org/board/ |archivedate=2006-08-23 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> She is a regular presenter at the annual Yoga Journal Conference.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.yjevents.com/yjevents/sf08/teacher_lasater_judith.cfm |title=Yoga Journal Conference Presenters |accessdate=2007-10-03|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20071023204550/http://www.yjevents.com/yjevents/sf08/teacher_lasater_judith.cfm |archivedate = 2007-10-23}}</ref>
Lasater has been called "One of the nation’s foremost (yoga) instructors," <ref>{{cite news |last=Kidston |first= Martin |title=Asana In Montana |url=http://www.helenair.com/articles/2006/11/26/helena_life/c01112606_01.txt|publisher=Helena Independent Record|date= 2006-11-25| accessdate=2006-12-04}}</ref> and a "yoga teaching star," <ref>{{cite news |last=Powers |first=Ann |title= American Influences Help Redefine Practice of Yoga |url=https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9E03E7D8163DF932A3575BC0A9669C8B63 |publisher=The New York Times |date=2000-08-01 |accessdate=2007-10-03}}</ref> having led workshops in 44 states plus Australia, Bolivia, Canada, China, England, France, Indonesia, Japan, Mexico, New Zealand, Peru, and Russia.<ref name="JHL"/>
She is the mother of three grown children.
==Publications==
Lasater has authored articles and yoga books such as:
*''Relax and Renew: Restful Yoga for Stressful Times,'' Rodmell Press, Berkeley, CA, 1995 (Co-authored with Mary Pullig Schatz), {{ISBN|0-9627138-4-8}} *''Living Your Yoga: Finding the Spiritual in Everyday Life,'' Rodmell Press, Berkeley, CA, 2000, {{ISBN|0-9627138-8-0}} *''Yoga for Pregnancy: What Every Mom-to-Be Needs to Know,'' Rodmell Press, Berkeley, CA, 2003, {{ISBN|1-930485-05-0}} *''30 Essential Yoga Poses: For Beginning Students and Their Teachers,'' Rodmell Press, Berkeley, CA, 2003, {{ISBN|1-930485-04-2}} *''Yoga Abs: Moving From Your Core,'' Rodmell Press, Berkeley, CA, 2005, {{ISBN|1-930485-09-3}} *''A Year of Living Your Yoga: Daily Practices to Shape Your Life,'' Rodmell Press, Berkeley, CA, 2006, {{ISBN|1-930485-15-8}} *''What We Say Matters: Practicing Nonviolent Communication,'' Rodmell Press, Berkeley, CA, 2009 (Co-authored with Ike K. Lasater), {{ISBN|1-9304852-4-7}} *''Yogabody: Anatomy, Kinesiology, and Asana,'' Rodmell Press, Berkeley, CA, 2009, {{ISBN|978-1-930485-21-1}}
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== <!--======================== {{No more links}} ============================ | PLEASE BE CAUTIOUS IN ADDING MORE LINKS TO THIS ARTICLE. Wikipedia | | is not a collection of links nor should it be used for advertising. | | | | Excessive or inappropriate links WILL BE DELETED. | | See [[Wikipedia:External links]] & [[Wikipedia:Spam]] for details. | | | | If there are already plentiful links, please propose additions or | | replacements on this article's discussion page, or submit your link | | to the relevant category at the Open Directory Project (dmoz.org) | | and link back to that category using the {{dmoz}} template. | ======================= {{No more links}} =============================--> *[http://www.judithlasater.com/ Judith Lasater's official website] * {{IMDb name|5324863}}

revision.text:
Many [[list of mathematics competitions|math competitions]] in the [[United States]] have regional restrictions. Of these, most are statewide.
For a more complete list, please visit [https://web.archive.org/web/20110119132429/http://homeschoolmathcontests.com/regional.aspx here] .
The contests include:
==Alabama== * [[Alabama Statewide High School Mathematics Contest]] * [[Virgil Grissom High School Math Tournament]] * [[Vestavia Hills High School Math Tournament]]
==Arizona== * [[Great Plains Math League]] * [[AATM State High School Contest]]
==California== * [[Bay Area Math Olympiad]] * [[Lawrence Livermore National Laboratories Annual High School Math Challenge]] * [[Cal Poly Math Contest]] and Trimathlon [http://www.calpoly.edu/~jshapiro/mathcontest.html] * [[Polya Competition]] * [[Bay Area Math Meet]] * [[College of Creative Studies Math Competition]] * [[LA Math Cup]] * [[Math Day at the Beach hosted by CSULB]][https://web.archive.org/web/20100311183246/http://www.csulb.edu/depts/math/mathday/index.htm] * [[Math Field Day for San Diego Middle Schools]] * [[Mesa Day Math Contest at UC Berkeley]] * [[Santa Barbara County Math Superbowl]] * [[Pomona College Mathematical Talent Search]] * [[Redwood Empire Mathematics Tournament hosted by Humboldt State (middle and high school)]] * [[San Diego Math League]] and [[San Diego Math Olympiad]] hosted by the [[San Diego Math Circle]] * [[Santa Clara University High School Mathematics Contest]] * [[Stanford Mathematics Tournament]] * [[UCSD/GSDMC High School Honors Mathematics Contest]]
==Colorado== * [[Colorado Mathematics Olympiad]]
==District of Columbia== *[http://m3challenge.siam.org/ Moody's Mega Math] ==Florida== * [[Florida-Stuyvesant Alumni Mathematics Competition]] * [[David Essner Mathematics Competition]] * [[James S. Rickards High School]] Fall Invitational * [[FAMAT]] Regional Competitions: * January Regional * February Regional * March Regional * FGCU Math Competition
==Georgia== *[[GA Council of Teachers of Mathematics State Varsity Math Tournament]] *[[STEM Olympiads Of America]][https://www.stemolympiads.com] Math, Science & Cyber Olympiads (grades 3 - 8) *[[Valdosta State University Middle Grades Mathematics Competition]]
==Illinois== *[[ICTM Math Contest]][https://web.archive.org/web/20110726170443/http://www.ictm.org/contest.html] (grades 3-8)
==Indiana== *[IUPUI High School Math Contest][https://web.archive.org/web/20130528093717/http://math.iupui.edu/community/math-contest] (grades 9-12) *[[Huntington University Math Competition]][http://www.huntington.edu/math/competition] (grades 6-12) *Indiana Math League *IASP Academic Super Bowl *[[Rose-Hulman High School Mathematics Contest]][http://www.rose-hulman.edu/~rickert/NovContest/] (grades 9-12) * Trine University Math Competition
==Iowa== * [[Great Plains Math League]]
==Kansas== * [[Great Plains Math League]]
==Louisiana== * [[Louisiana State University Mathematics Contest for high school students]][http://www.math.lsu.edu/~contest/]
==Maine== * [[Pi-Cone South Math League]] * [[Maine Association of Math Leagues]]
==Maryland== *[http://www.math.umd.edu/highschool/mathcomp/ The University of Maryland High School Mathematics Competition] *[http://www.salisbury.edu/mathcosc/hsmc/#about The Eastern Shore High School Mathematics Competition] *[https://www.marylandsurveyor.org/page/TrigStar? Maryland Trig-Star] *[http://old.mathleague.com/REGISTER.HTM Maryland Math League] *[http://math.jhu.edu/~mathclub/jhmt.html JHU Math Competition]
==Massachusetts== * [[Harvard–MIT Mathematics Tournament]] * [[Worcester Polytechnic Institute Mathematics Meet]] * [[Massachusetts Mathematics Olympiad]] * [[Greater Boston Mathematics League]] * [[Massachusetts Mathematics League]] * [[Southeastern Massachusetts Mathematics League]] * [[Southern Massachusetts Conference Mathematics League]] * [[Western Massachusetts Mathematics League]] * [[Worcester County Mathematics League]] * [[Intermediate Math League of Eastern Massachusetts]]
==Michigan== * [[Lower Michigan Mathematics Competition]] (college) * [[Michigan Autumn Take Home]][https://web.archive.org/web/20110530173702/http://www.mcs.alma.edu/mathchallenge/] (college)
==Minnesota== * [[Minnesota State High School Math League]] * [[St. Cloud State University Math Competition]]
==Missouri== * [[KCATM Math Contests]][http://07contest.kcatm.org/] (grades 3-12) * [[Missouri Collegiate Mathematics Competition]] * [[Missouri Council of Teachers of Mathematics Math Contests]][https://web.archive.org/web/20110408115029/http://math.missouristate.edu/44540.htm] (grades 4-12) * [[Great Plains Math League]]
==New Jersey== * [[WWPMT]] ([[West Windsor-Plainsboro Math Tournament]])[http://www.wwpmt.org/main] (grades 3-8)
==New York== * [[Nassau County Interscholastic Mathematics League]] * [[New York City Interscholastic Mathematics League]] * [[New York State Mathematics League]] * [[New York Math League]] * [[Suffolk County Math Tournament]][http://worknotes.com/ny/suffolk/scmta/h5.stm]
==North Carolina== * [[Duke University Math Math Meet]] * [[North Carolina State High School Math Contest]]
==Ohio==
* [[Ohio Council of Teachers of Mathematics (OCTM) State Contest]][http://www.octmtournament.org/] * [[Ohio Mathematics Invitational Olympiad (OHMIO)]][http://www.octmtournament.org/ohmio/]
==Oklahoma== * [[OSU High School Math Contest]]

==Rhode Island== * [[Rhode Island Math League]]
==South Carolina==
* [[Clemson Calculus Challenge]][https://web.archive.org/web/20100818110915/http://www.math.clemson.edu/ccc/] * [[Coastal Carolina University Math Competition]][http://www.coastal.edu/math/mathcontest/] * [[College of Charleston Math Meet]][https://web.archive.org/web/20110823004307/http://math.cofc.edu/mathmeet/] * [[Florence-Darlington Tech Math Competition]][http://math.fdtc.edu] * [[Furman University Wylie Mathematics Tournament]][http://math.furman.edu/tournament/tournament.html] * [[Pee-Dee Regional High-School Mathematics Tournament]] [https://web.archive.org/web/20080724030945/http://acsweb.fmarion.edu/math/competition/hp_competition.htm] * [[University of South Carolina High School Math Contest]][http://www.math.sc.edu/contest/] * [[USC Aiken Math Competition]] * [[USC Upstate Math Competition]][https://web.archive.org/web/20110718215143/http://faculty.uscupstate.edu/kwaters/MathContest/info.html] * Wando High [[Mu Alpha Theta]] Tournament[https://web.archive.org/web/20061125202645/http://www.wandohigh.com/clubs/mao/tournament.htm]
==Texas== * [[Rice Mathematics Tournament]] * [[Texas A&M University Mathematics Tournament]] * Texas Academy of Mathematics and Science Tournament [https://web.archive.org/web/20110716191806/http://www.tamstournament.com/]
==Utah== * [http://www.utmath.org/ Utah Math Olympiad] * [http://www.math.usu.edu/index.php?program=smc/ Utah State Math Contest] * [http://www.snow.edu/math/contest/ Snow College Math Contest]
==Virginia== *[https://web.archive.org/web/20110820182256/http://math.cnu.edu/contest.htm Christopher Newport University Regional High School Mathematics]
==Washington== *[http://www.blaine.wednet.edu/mathchamps/Middle_School/Home.html Washington State Math Championship] *[http://www.blaine.wednet.edu/mathchamps/High_School/Home.html Northwest Math Championship] *[http://www.academicsarecool.com/ Math is Cool Championships] *[http://www.academicsarecool.com/ Math is Cool Masters] *[[Mount Rainier Mathematics Invitational]] *[[Washington State Mu Alpha Theta]] *[http://www.newportmathclub.org/kpmt/ Knights of Pi Math Tournament (KPMT)] *[http://www.interlakemathclub.com/i2mc.html Interlake Invitational Math Contest (I<sup>2</sup>MC)]{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} *[http://www.wastudentmath.org/contests/mathbowl/ WSMA Math Bowl]
==Wisconsin== * [[Wisconsin Mathematics, Engineering, and Science Talent Search]]
==West Virginia== * West Virginia State [[Math Field Day]]

{{see also|List of national libraries}} This is an alphabetical '''list of notable [[library|libraries]]''' around the world. It includes both notable public lending libraries and [[research library|research libraries]]. {{compact ToC|side=yes|top=yes|num=no|seealso=yes|extlinks=yes|refs=yes}}

===A=== [[File:Berlin AmerikaGedenkBibliothek 2.jpg|thumb|American Memorial Library]] * [[Advocates' Library]], [[Edinburgh]], Scotland * [[African Heritage Research Library and Cultural Centre]], [[Adeyipo Village]], [[Ibadan]], [[Nigeria]] * [[Alexandria Library, Virginia|Alexandria Library]], Alexandria, Virginia, United States * [[Alice Springs Public Library]], [[Alice Springs]], Australia * [[Allahabad Public Library]], [[Allahabad]], India * [[Allegheny County Library Association]], [[Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania]] * [[Aloghar Library]], [[Dhaka]], [[Bangladesh]] * [[American Memorial Library]], [[Berlin]], Germany * [[Ann Arbor District Library]], [[Ann Arbor]], [[Michigan]], United States * [[Archive for Research in Archetypal Symbolism]] * [[Argostoli Public Library]], [[Kefalonia]], [[Greece]] * [[Arlanza Branch Library]], [[Riverside County, California|Riverside]], [[California]], United States * [[Astan Quds Razavi's Central Library]], [[Mashhad]], [[Iran]] * [[Australian National University Library]], Canberra, Australia

revision.comment: /* Third collective agreement */ fixed issues in citation
revision.text:
{{Orphan|date=December 2011}}
The '''McGill University Non-Academic Certified Association (MUNACA)''' is a [[Trade union|labour union]] at [[McGill University]] representing roughly 1700 non-academic support staff.
==History== ===Formation===
MUNACA was formed in 1992 and certified as a union by the Quebec Labour Relations Commission in 1993.<ref>David Roseman, representing MUNACA Executive Board</ref> Its first president, Allan Youster, was a former president of the non-unionized McGill University Non-academic Staff Association (MUNASA) for ten years.<ref>{{cite web|title=New members of McGill's board|url=http://reporter-archive.mcgill.ca/Rep/r2810/board.htm|work=McGill Reporter|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref>
===First collective agreement===
MUNACA tabled its proposal for a first collective agreement in August 1995.<ref>{{cite web|last=McCabe|first=Daniel|title=Agreeing to Disagree|url=http://reporter-archive.mcgill.ca/Rep/r2915/youster.html|work=McGill Reporter|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref> In late summer 1996, MUNACA requested the appointment of a conciliator due to stalled negotiations and a multi-year salary freeze.<ref>{{cite web|last=Smith|first=Eric|title=Unions United|url=http://reporter-archive.mcgill.ca/Rep/r2903/unions.htm|work=McGill Reporter|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref> Conciliation began on September 17, 1996, but the conciliator stated that an impasse had been reached on April 9, 1997 over issues of salary and job security, leading McGill to call in an arbitrator with the authority to set the terms of an agreement.<ref>{{cite web|last=McCabe|first=Daniel|title=Agreeing to Disagree|url=http://reporter-archive.mcgill.ca/Rep/r2915/youster.html|work=McGill Reporter|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref> In 1998, MUNACA members voted to engage in pressure campaign, including sizeable protests supported by fellow unions [[Service Employees International Union|SEIU Local 800]] (property services) and [[Association of Graduate Students Employed at McGill|AGSEM]] ([[teaching assistant]]s).<ref>{{cite web|last=McCabe|first=Daniel|title=Union Mounts Pressure Campaign|url=http://reporter-archive.mcgill.ca/Rep/r3015/munaca.html|work=McGill Reporter|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Smith|first=Eric|title=Unions United|url=http://reporter-archive.mcgill.ca/Rep/r2903/unions.htm|work=McGill Reporter|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref> Meanwhile, attrition reduced the size of the union by 500. In February 1999, MUNACA members voted overwhelmingly in favor of a contract which included a retroactive 3.5% salary increase with 1% progression followed by a 1.5% increase with 1.5% progression. The contract eliminated discretionary merit increases, placed greater (but not exclusive) weight on seniority in job selection, and included a compromise on employment security. Non-unionized staff also received largely the same salary increase.<ref>{{cite web|last=McCabe|first=Daniel|title=Union Deal Struck|url=http://reporter-archive.mcgill.ca/Rep/r3111/munaca.html|work=McGill Reporter|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref>
===Second collective agreement===
Negotiations began for a second collective agreement in November 2002.<ref>{{cite web|last=Reynolds|first=Mark|title=MUNACA negotiations|url=https://www.mcgill.ca/reporter/36/02/munaca/|work=McGill Reporter|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref> In September 2003, the university added a new demand to the table: increasing work hours for MUNACA members without additional compensation. In response, MUNACA members authorized pressure tactics, including a protest, and suspended talks until the demand was rescinded. Concern about overwork of MUNACA members was raised by faculty and MUNASA members at the McGill Senate.<ref>{{cite web|last=Wilner|first=Josh|title=MUNACA negotiations at a standstill|url=http://www.mcgilltribune.com/2.12363/munaca-negotiations-at-a-standstill-1.1634407|work=McGill Tribune|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref> McGill later withdrew the demand for increased working hours and the parties entered conciliation at McGill's request.<ref>{{cite web|last=Wilner|first=Josh|title=MUNACA in conciliation with university|url=http://www.mcgilltribune.com/2.12363/news-briefs-1.1634104|work=McGill Tribune|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref> In December 2003, MUNACA members overwhelmingly rejected McGill's offer and authorized a strike. They also participated in a voluntary half-day walkout and demonstration. Partly at issue were floating holidays and summer Fridays.<ref>{{cite web|last=Reynolds|first=Mark|title=MUNACA Votes for Action|url=https://www.mcgill.ca/reporter/36/07/munaca/|work=McGill Reporter|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref> Later in December, MUNACA members voted to accept a contract offering 2% scale increases and 2.2-2.5% progressions, along with compensation for the loss of summer Fridays and an increase in salary minima.<ref>{{cite web|last=Reynolds|first=Mark|title=MUNACA deal|url=https://www.mcgill.ca/reporter/36/08/munaca/|work=McGill Reporter|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref>
===Interim===
As MUNACA was not affiliated with any [[List of federations of trade unions|larger union]], several attempts were made by both members and external unions to affiliate, sometimes leading to strife.<ref>{{cite web|title=MUNACA Raided by CUPE & Local 800 (SEU)|url=http://www.munaca.com/sites/data/bulletins/20031102-executive-takes-a-stand.pdf|work=MUNACA Bulletin|accessdate=2 October 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Should MUNACA pursue the issue of affiliation with a major union organization at this time?|url=http://www.munaca.com/sites/data/bulletins/20040426-executive-bulletin.pdf|work=MUNACA Bulletin|accessdate=2 October 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=MUNACA IS STILL YOUR UNION!|url=http://www.munaca.com/sites/data/bulletins/20070705-munaca-is-still-your-union.pdf|work=MUNACA Bulletin|accessdate=2 October 2011}}</ref> Additionally, MUNACA was forced to deal with representatives sending messages judged prejudicial to the good name of the union.<ref>{{cite web|title=T Council Bulletin|url=http://www.munaca.com/sites/data/bulletins/20050210-t-council-bulletin.pdf|work=T Council Bulletin|accessdate=2 October 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=MUNACA Bulletin|url=http://www.munaca.com/sites/data/bulletins/20050324-t-council-bulletin.pdf|work=MUNACA Bulletin|accessdate=2 October 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=MUNACA EXPELS L-COUNCIL REPRESENTATIVES|url=http://www.munaca.com/sites/data/bulletins/20070619-L-council-bulletin.pdf|work=MUNACA Bulletin|accessdate=2 October 2011}}</ref> In March 2005, MUNACA raised dues by 10% to implement a [[strike fund]] in preparation for the next round of negotiations.<ref>{{cite web|title=Strike Fund Implementation|url=http://www.munaca.com/sites/data/bulletins/20050406-executive-bulletin.pdf|work=Executive Bulletin|accessdate=2 October 2011}}</ref>
===Third collective agreement===
Negotiations for a third collective agreement began on December 17, 2007. The university originally offered annual scale increases of 2% and progression of 2.5% and reiterated requests for increased work hours and reform of summer Fridays.<ref>{{cite web|title=Negotiation Bulletin - Proposals|work=MUNACA Bulletin|url=http://www.munaca.com/sites/data/bulletins/20080215-negotiation-bulletin-feb.pdf|accessdate=8 October 2011}}</ref> However, on February 7, 2008, the university tabled new demands, reducing its salary offer to scale increases of 1% and progression of 1-1.5% and requesting an end to employment security for newer employees.<ref>{{cite web|title=Negotiation Committee Bulletin|work=MUNACA Bulletin|url=http://www.munaca.com/sites/data/bulletins/20080215-negotiation-bulletin-feb.pdf|accessdate=8 October 2011}}</ref> After reaching an impasse, the union called a general meeting on August 28, 2008, days before the start of the school year, to vote to reject McGill's offer and authorize pressure tactics, up to and including a strike, in response.<ref>{{cite web|title=Notice - Special Meeting of the MUNACA General Assembly|url=http://www.munaca.com/sites/data/bulletins/20080820-AGM-special-meeting.pdf|work=MUNACA Bulletin|accessdate=8 October 2011}}</ref> With the room filled to capacity and some workers denied entry by security guards due to fire codes, a fire alarm was pulled, forcing an evacuation and preventing the strike vote from taking place.<ref>{{cite web|last=Markowitz|first=Jennifer|title=Fire alarm prevents MUNACA strike vote|url=http://www.mcgilldaily.com/2008/09/fire_alarm_prevents_munaca_strike_vote/|work=McGill Daily|accessdate=8 October 2011}}</ref> Soon after, an agreement in principle between the negotiation teams was reached including 1-2% scale increases and 1.5% progression, status quo on summer Fridays, night and weekend premiums, and lump sum payments for members at their pay maximum.<ref>{{cite web|title=Executive Bulletin|url=http://www.munaca.com/sites/data/bulletins/20080829-agreement-details.pdf|work=MUNACA Bulletin|accessdate=8 October 2011}}</ref> However, 62% of MUNACA members rejected this proposal at a general assembly, largely due to the disparity in wage increase compared to other jobs at McGill.<ref>{{cite web|last=Klasa|first=Adrienne|title=MUNACA snubs another McGill proposal|url=http://www.mcgilldaily.com/2008/09/munaca_snubs_another_mcgill_proposal/|work=McGill Daily|accessdate=8 October 2011}}</ref> On September 23, 2008, MUNACA filed for conciliation after the university signaled it would not change its offer.<ref>{{cite web|title=Negotiation Update Bulletin|url=http://www.munaca.com/sites/data/bulletins/20081001-negotiation-bulletin.pdf|work=MUNACA Bulletin|accessdate=9 October 2011}}</ref> On October 14, 2008, the university responded by offering 2% scale increases and 1% progression for four years, a better offer for employees at their pay maximum. MUNACA rejected this offer after meeting with its Council representatives.<ref>{{cite web|title=Negotiation Update Bulletin|url=http://www.munaca.com/sites/data/bulletins/20081017-negotiation-update-bulletin.pdf|work=MUNACA Bulletin|accessdate=9 October 2011}}</ref> After the university responded by offering an 8.5% increase over three years, on December 4, 2008, the general membership voted 68.4% to formally reject the university's offer and 65.1% to authorize pressure tactics up to an including a general strike.<ref>{{cite web|title=MUNACA rejects contract offer|publisher=McGill Reporter|url=http://publications.mcgill.ca/reporter/2008/12/munaca-rejects-contract-offer/|accessdate=9 October 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Executive Bulletin|url=http://www.munaca.com/sites/data/bulletins/20081204-results-of-special-meeting-of-general-assembly.pdf|work=MUNACA Bulletin|accessdate=9 October 2011}}</ref> In response, MUNACA held several demonstrations and printed several full page ads in major Montreal newspapers.<ref>{{cite web|title=Negotiation Update|url=http://www.munaca.com/sites/data/bulletins/20081222-negotiation-update-bulletin.pdf|work=MUNACA Bulletin|accessdate=9 October 2011}}</ref> The conciliator recommended a 9% salary increase over three years. Perhaps partly due to fear of striking during an economic downturn, MUNACA members voted 84% to accept the offer, though the recommendation was accepted "without enthusiasm", according to then-President Maria Ruocco.<ref>{{cite web|last=Quail|first=Thomas|title=MUNACA and McGill reach labour agreement|url=http://www.mcgilltribune.com/2.12329/munaca-and-mcgill-reach-labour-agreement-1.1627011#.TpEmaMlmJHo|work=McGill Tribune|accessdate=9 October 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Graham|first=Courtney|title=MUNACA compromises on settlement|url=http://www.mcgilldaily.com/2009/04/munaca_compromises_on_settlement/|work=McGill Daily|accessdate=9 October 2011}}</ref>
===Reaction of University Administration - Removal of Senate Representation===
Members of MUNACA became ineligible to sit on the McGill Senate upon unionizing, due to regulations permitting staff representation to only non-unionized staff. Because the formation of MUNACA reduced non-unionized staff from 2,719 to 781, the Senate Steering Committee considered the case. The Steering Committee recommended against allowing union members to sit on Senate, partly for fear they would vote as a bloc, and further recommended reducing non-unionized staff representation from six members to three. The recommendation to reduce staff representation was defeated, but MUNACA members remain ineligible to sit on Senate.<ref>{{cite web|last=Jarosiewicz|first=Karl|title=Senate Highlights|url=http://reporter-archive.mcgill.ca/Rep/r2810/sen0131.htm|work=McGill Reporter|accessdate=1 October 2011}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[http://legaleaseckut.wordpress.com/2011/09/09/episode-25-sept-2011-on-strike/ LegalEase Radio - On Strike! (September 2011)]
[[Category:McGill University]] [[Category:Education-related professional associations]]
